Package ch.tbz.lib

Class Input

java.lang.Object
ch.tbz.lib.Input
public class Input extends Object
Input Methods like the BASIC INPUT (or c's scanf()). Because Java has no simple console input, I added this functions to my library. Simply import import static ch.tbz.lib.Input.* and then use int x = inputInt("Please enter x: ");
Version:
0.1 (Oct 8, 2014) Original, 0.2 (Jan 24, 2020) JavaDoc updated, 0.3 (Jan 25, 2020) inputDate, inputTime, inputDateTime added
Author:
Philipp Gressly Freimann V0.1, Michael Kellenberger V0.2 ...

  • Constructor Details

    • Input

      public Input()

  • Method Details

    • setAskAgain

      public static void setAskAgain​(boolean askAgain)
      If askAgain is false, the user is asked only once.
      Parameters:
      askAgain - Entering newlines do not ask the user again showing the "question". default: true

    • setNumberFormatError

      public static void setNumberFormatError​(String errorMessage)
      This message is shown to the user, if she/he does not enter a number while using "intputInt()" or "inputDouble()".
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - to show on NumberFormatExceptions.

    • setDTFormatError

      public static void setDTFormatError​(String errorMessage)
      This message is shown to the user, if she/he does not enter a date or time while using intput-Date and/or -Time.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - to show on DateTimeFormatExceptions.

    • setAddQuestion

      public static void setAddQuestion​(String addQuestion)
      If the programmer only wants to ask for a "value" instead of a "question", this text has to be set. Typically: setAddQuestion("Please enter the value for %s : "); "%s" is replaced by the programmers question afterwards.
      Parameters:
      addQuestion - has to contain a %s, where the parameter name should be replaced.

    • inputString

      public static String inputString​(String question)
      Asks for a string value
      Parameters:
      question - any Question having a text as answer
      Returns:
      the given text

      Returns:

      public static float inputFloat​(String question)
      Asks for a long value public static long inputLong(String question) { return (long) inputNumber(question, long.class); } /** Asks for a float value

      Returns:

      Returns:
      the given double precision number

    • inputChar

      public static char inputChar​(String question)
      Asks for a single char. Any further chars on the same line are ignored.
      Parameters:
      question - any Question having a character as answer.
      Returns:
      the given character number

    • inputBoolean

      public static boolean inputBoolean​(String question)
      Asks for a decision. Returns true, if the users input does not start with the letter 'n'.
      Parameters:
      question - any Question having "yes" or "no" as answer.
      Returns:
      true if the users answer does not start with an "n" or "N".

    • inputDateTime

      public static LocalDateTime inputDateTime​(String question)
      Asks for a single date and time data, formatted like tt.mm.yyyy hh:mm:ss
      Parameters:
      question - any Question having a datetime as answer.
      Returns:
      the given date

    • inputDate

      public static LocalDate inputDate​(String question)
      Asks for a single date data, formatted like tt.mm.yyyy
      Parameters:
      question - any Question having a date as answer.
      Returns:
      the given date
